newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bond prices mixed, U.S., Germany in focus.
newsitem.headline: Danish bond prices mixed, U.S., Germany in focus.

text.p: Danish bond prices were mixed on Friday, failing to keep up with the German market in a market focused on general U.S. developments.
"We've been limping after the German market all day so far. The Danish market is not doing so well, we are keeping an eye on Wall Street and nervous about things there," one dealer said.

The benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 was 0.03 point down from the day's start at 110.25 yielding 6.43 percent in turnover of 2.5 billion crowns, while the forthcoming seven percent 2007 benchmark was 0.04 point up from the start at 102.80 yielding 6.61 percent in 800 million crown turnover.
The 2006 benchmark's June future fell 0.38 point to 110.00 with 208 contracts traded. The six percent mortgage bond due 2026 lost 0.35 point to 88.75.
The crown traded at 3.8078 per mark at 1145 gmt, down a pinch from around 3.8075 at the opening.
The yield gap between the 2006 bond and the German bund remained at 52 basis points compared to Thursday's 50 points, while the 2007-bund gap narrowed two points to 71 bp.
